Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the Thai government ordered a shoot-at-sight at the border for illegal entries, which is proven to be false.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no shoot-to-kill order had been issued against migrants from Myanmar by the Thai government.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove its validity.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Thai government ordered the military to shoot on sight, which is not supported by any factual evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the Thai government spokesperson, stating that the footage was from an anti-smuggling operation and not related to shooting on sight.
